Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a TCP proxy server using Vert.x that forwards incoming connections to a remote server after writing a custom header.

Class Description: The HAProxy class acts as a TCP proxy server that listens for incoming connections, establishes connections to a remote server, writes a specified header to the remote connection, and then pipes data bidirectionally between the client and server.

Attributes:
- log: Logger - Logger instance for logging debug and error messages
- HOST: String - The host address where the proxy server will listen (default: "localhost")
- PORT: int - The port number where the proxy server will listen (default: 11080)
- remoteAddress: SocketAddress - The address of the remote server to forward connections to
- header: Buffer - The header data to write to the remote connection
- server: NetServer - The Vert.x TCP server instance
- client: NetClient - The Vert.x TCP client instance for connecting to remote server
- connectionRemoteAddress: SocketAddress - Stores the remote address of the established connection
- connectionLocalAddress: SocketAddress - Stores the local address of the established connection

Methods:
- HAProxy(SocketAddress remoteAddress, Buffer header) -> HAProxy - Constructor that initializes the proxy with remote server address and header data
- start(Vertx vertx) -> HAProxy - Starts the proxy server, configures connection handling, and returns the instance (throws Exception if startup fails)
- stop() -> void - Stops the proxy server and cleans up resources
- getConnectionRemoteAddress() -> SocketAddress - Returns the remote address of the established connection
- getConnectionLocalAddress() -> SocketAddress - Returns the local address of the established connection
